title: Trump's pardons, Ozempic, and cheaper turkey: Unpacking Thanskgiving 2025
description: But this year, the performance feels different. The pardon stands on one end of the cultural table, loud and ceremonial, while the rest of Thanksgiving sits on the other end, quieter and lighter than before. Turkeys are cheaper, appetites are shrinking, and the national feast is no longer quite the binge it once was. Somehow, everything around the ritual has changed, and the ritual itself has stayed exactly the same — which might be the most American thing about it.

‘IIT-Bombay as IIT-Mumbai’: Fadnavis to write to PM Modi; move after MNS criticism
description: Maharashtra Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis will write to the Prime Minister and Union Education Ministry to officially rename IIT-Bombay to IIT-Mumbai. This follows criticism from the MNS over Union Minister Jitendra Singh's remarks suggesting the institute should retain its original name. The state government considers the renaming demand legitimate.

title: 'No, genuinely no’: Ex-CJI Gavai says never faced pressure from political leadership
description: Ex Chief Justice of India BR Gavai stated he faced no executive pressure and defended the Collegium system's transparency. He cautioned against judicial overreach, emphasizing courts must act within constitutional limits, especially when addressing "bulldozer justice" and collective punishment.

title: How to flatter Trump 101: US envoy gave lesson to Russia on peace deal; call exposes coaching
description: A US envoy reportedly advised Russia's top foreign policy adviser on how President Putin should pitch a peace plan to then-President Trump. The plan, discussed with Trump's team, aimed to leverage Trump's perceived role as a "man of peace" following a Gaza deal. The White House described the approach as "standard negotiating procedure."

title: Socialite Orry finally appears before Mumbai Police in drugs case
Why coach Gambhir, chief selector Agarkar are answerable for home debacles
description: Indian cricket faces a crisis after recent home Test series losses. Coach Gautam Gambhir is under pressure amid team's poor performance. Questions arise about planning and player selection. The team's fortress has collapsed, leading to a need for strategic changes. This situation demands attention and a clear path forward for Indian cricket.

'Went for morning walk ...': CJI flags toxic Delhi air; SC may shift to virtual hearings
description: Chief Justice of India Surya Kant is considering a shift to virtual-only Supreme Court proceedings due to Delhi's severe air pollution, after personally experiencing ill effects. The proposal, which may include options for senior lawyers to appear online, will be discussed with the Bar before any decision is made.

description: Rising Latin artist DELAROSA, 22, was tragically shot and killed in a violent ambush in Northridge, Los Angeles, over the weekend. The singer was in a parked car when assailants opened fire. Despite being rushed to the hospital, she was pronounced dead on arrival.

Massive fire engulfs multiple high rises in Hong Kong; at least 4 dead - video
description: A devastating fire ripped through multiple high-rise towers at Wang Fuk Court in Hong Kong's Tai Po district, claiming at least four lives and trapping several others. Firefighters battled thick smoke billowing from the 31-storey residential blocks, which house approximately 2,000 apartments, as two residents remained in critical condition with burn injuries.

description: South Africa achieved a historic Test series triumph in India, winning the second Test by a massive 408 runs. This marked India's largest-ever defeat by runs and South Africa's first series win on Indian soil in 25 years. Off-spinner Simon Harmer was instrumental, taking 17 wickets and becoming South Africa's leading wicket-taker in India.

title: Where is Imran Khan? Rumours over ex-Pak PM take over social media; sisters assaulted
description: Speculation surrounds Imran Khan's fate after his sisters were allegedly assaulted by police while seeking a meeting. Social media claims he was killed in Adiala Jail, where he has been held since August 2023. His sisters reported a "brutal and orchestrated assault" by Punjab police during a peaceful protest outside the jail.

description: Controversy erupted after Jammie Booker won the World's Strongest Woman competition, with many questioning her gender identity. Riley Gaines publicly criticized Booker's win, sharing a meme and supporting claims that Andrea Thompson was the rightful winner. Gaines has consistently advocated for fairness in women's sports, previously clashing with Simone Biles over trans athletes.

This bold stance shatters Japan's strategic ambiguity, placing Tokyo directly in China's crosshairs. Takaichi, a nationalist figure, faces both domestic praise and international condemnation for her unapologetic remarks.

Google chips threaten Nvidia: Stock drops $250B; claims 'we lead industry'
description: Nvidia, the AI chip giant, publicly defended its market dominance after reports surfaced of Meta Platforms considering billions in spending on Google's competing AI chips. This news sent Nvidia's stock down significantly, while Alphabet shares rose. Google's Tensor Processing Units (TPUs) are emerging as a serious challenger, with Meta potentially renting them from Google Cloud.

title: A multi-quadrillionaire! How one man accidentally became the richest man of all time
description: In July 2013, Pennsylvania resident Chris Reynolds opened his PayPal account and briefly found £70 quadrillion sitting there, instantly making him wealthier than Elon Musk, Jeff Bezos and any billionaire in history. The amount, the result of an error, vanished within minutes as PayPal corrected the glitch and apologised. Reynolds joked about paying off national debt and buying the Phillies before returning to reality.

title: Ayesha Curry shares heartfelt note for Stephen days after marriage controversy
description: Ayesha Curry posted a heartwarming message for her husband Stephen Curry's new book, "Shot Ready," amidst recent online backlash. She had previously expressed on a podcast that she didn't initially want marriage or children, leading to fan outrage and accusations of disrespecting her husband.

title: Charlie McAvoy faces heartbreaking week as wife Kiley shares family update
description: Boston Bruins defenseman Charlie McAvoy is going through a devastating week. As his wife Kiley McAvoy revealed an emotional family update on social media. With Charlie already recovering from recent jaw surgery. The couple is now facing additional personal challenges involving their young son.

title: Amazon to employees: No new third-party AI tools; pushes for house instead
description: Amazon has directed its software engineers to avoid using third-party AI coding tools like OpenAI's Codex and Anthropic's Claude Code, instead use its proprietary system, Kiro. This strategic move aims to bolster Amazon's competitive standing against rivals OpenAI and Google in the rapidly expanding AI code assistant market.
